image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Rizwan b Wahab Riaz
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Mohammad Rizwan b Wahab Riaz 132 (135b 15x4 3x6 186m) SR: 97.77

dismissalComment.html: And the stand has finally ended! This was dug in short, off-speed ball outside off as Tamim backs away. He initially looked to pull it away, then skews it high into the air. The man from covers (Azhar Ali I guess) and mid-off (Saad Nasim) converge, collide, but Saad Nasim just about hangs onto the catch. Tamim elicits a standing ovation

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c †Sarfaraz Ahmed b Wahab Riaz 106 (77b 13x4 2x6 117m) SR: 137.66

dismissalComment.html: End of a rapid knock from Mushfiq. Dug in on a back of a length and outside off, Mushfiq has a big swing at that, does not get hold of it. Nicks it to the keeper off a thick outside edge. He raises his bat and acknowledges the raucous cheers as he walks back to the hut. The umpires check for a possible no-ball, Wahab exults, that's a legal ball

And the stand has finally ended! This was dug in short, off-speed ball outside off as Tamim backs away. He initially looked to pull it away, then skews it high into the air. The man from covers (Azhar Ali I guess) and mid-off (Saad Nasim) converge, collide, but Saad Nasim just about hangs onto the catch. Tamim elicits a standing ovation

End of a rapid knock from Mushfiq. Dug in on a back of a length and outside off, Mushfiq has a big swing at that, does not get hold of it. Nicks it to the keeper off a thick outside edge. He raises his bat and acknowledges the raucous cheers as he walks back to the hut. The umpires check for a possible no-ball, Wahab exults, that's a legal ball

Wahab has shattered the stumps. Why was he appealing? The leg stump is knocked out, that's your wicket Riaz. This was a near yorker hurled in from wide of the crease, Sabbir attempts a dinky little reverse-sweep and misses, the leg stump is rattled

Shakib given out lbw off the last ball. He wants to review, but this was crashing into the base of middle. Low full toss, Shakib shuffles across and misses the attempted sweep and rapped in front middle. The on-field umpire's decision prevails. But Bangladesh have put up a record-breaking total - their highest in ODIs

Rahat Ali strikes! Mahmudullah steps away outside leg, seeks to crash it through the covers, but misses his stroke completely. This back-of-a-length slower ball crashes into the middle stump. It is knocked out

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar run out (Wahab Riaz) 20 (36b 3x4 0x6 62m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: Sarkar is in trouble, he has to depart. 85.3mph back of a length and hurries on middle and off, Tamim manages an inside edge onto the pad, which rolls onto the pitch, adjacent to the off side. The pair want to sneak in a quick single. Wahab runs towards the ball, collects it, under-arm flicks it back onto the stumps and even plucks out the leg stump. Sarkar's bat was on the line by the time the bails came off the groove. He is OUT and the TV umpire confirms it as well

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Rahat Ali 5 (18b 0x4 0x6 30m) SR: 27.77

dismissalComment.html: Rahat Ali strikes! Mahmudullah steps away outside leg, seeks to crash it through the covers, but misses his stroke completely. This back-of-a-length slower ball crashes into the middle stump. It is knocked out

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Azhar Ali c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 72 (73b 7x4 0x6 118m) SR: 98.63

dismissalComment.html: Taskin sets off on a aeroplane celebration, a la Shoaib Akhtar, he is charged up. Azhar Ali perishes for 72. This was on a back of a length and outside off, Azar seeks to run it away through slip, instead edges it to the keeper, who moves to his right and snaffles it

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan c Nasir Hossain b Rubel Hossain 67 (58b 8x4 0x6 84m) SR: 115.51

dismissalComment.html: Another one bites the dust, Rizwan gone for 67 off 58. He fetches the slog sweep from outside off but top-edges it in the air. Nasir runs across to his right from deep square leg and swallows it

Sarfraz goes for a  slog-sweep and holes out. This was flat on off, he does not middle the sweep, Nasir Hossain runs to his left from deep backward square leg and snaps up a sharp tumbling catch. Shakib is pumped. Sarfraz slams his bat onto the turf as he trudges back.

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Fawad Alam steps away outside leg, Sunny follows him with a full toss, which is softly chipped to Sarkar, who reverse-cups his hands around it at mid-off. The bowler breaks into a little jig. The asking rate reads 10.59
Sunny knocks Nasim for a duck on debut. Nasim makes room, this was the arm-ball on off. Too close to cut, Nasim does not meet with the stroke. Cannons onto off

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Taskin sets off on a aeroplane celebration, a la Shoaib Akhtar, he is charged up. Azhar Ali perishes for 72. This was on a back of a length and outside off, Azar seeks to run it away through slip, instead edges it to the keeper, who moves to his right and snaffles it

Crucial strike, Harris has to depart, Taskin has his second. This was dug in short and rushes onto Haris, who miscues the pull in the air. Mahmudullah runs in from mid-on and pouches it, tumbling to the ground. Haris threw his head back as soon as he met the ball. He knew that he had made a hash of the pull

Taskin hoodwinks Wahab with a well-disguised slower one from the back of the hand. Wahab steps away and aims to slog it away over the leg side, but does not connect. He was way too early into it and Taskin hits the top of middle and leg

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Arafat Sunny
dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed c Nasir Hossain b Arafat Sunny 24 (31b 3x4 0x6 42m) SR: 77.41

dismissalComment.html: Sarfraz goes for a  slog-sweep and holes out. This was flat on off, he does not middle the sweep, Nasir Hossain runs to his left from deep backward square leg and snaps up a sharp tumbling catch. Shakib is pumped. Sarfraz slams his bat onto the turf as he trudges back.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez run out (Soumya Sarkar/†Mushfiqur Rahim) 4 (7b 1x4 0x6 8m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Fine throw from Sarkar, Hafeez has been run out. Azhar uses his feet and drives it in front of mid-on off an inside edge. The pair look for a scampered single, Hafeez is late to take off. Sarkar swoops down on the ball and lasers an accurate, flat throw to the keeper, who whips the bails off to catch Hafeez short. He was guilty of ball watching and pays the penalty

headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Junaid Khan run out (Sabbir Rahman) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: another yorker, which is dug out to point. The fielder nails a direct hit at the non-strikers' as there is a communication breakdown, but Junaid is in. Oh no, the bat is in the air. Nice, flat throw, hits the bullseye. The bat was in the air and Junaid has to depart for a duck. Poor mix-up..

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Saeed Ajmal lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh break 16-year hoodoo with a 79-run win. Ajmal has been given out lbw, Shakib shakes hands with the umpire. Ajmal reviews. This was pushed through flat and quick from round the stumps, catches Ajmal on the front pad on the knee roll, looks like this was sliding down. Or was it clipping leg? No inner edge. Hawk-Eye shows that it would clip the top of leg. Bangladesh break the 16-year drought and record their second ODI win over Pakistan

dismissalText.commentary: Saeed Ajmal lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh break 16-year hoodoo with a 79-run win. Ajmal has been given out lbw, Shakib shakes hands with the umpire. Ajmal reviews. This was pushed through flat and quick from round the stumps, catches Ajmal on the front pad on the knee roll, looks like this was sliding down. Or was it clipping leg? No inner edge. Hawk-Eye shows that it would clip the top of leg. Bangladesh break the 16-year drought and record their second ODI win over Pakistan

commentPostTextItems.html: Thanks for joining us today. Do come back for the second ODI on Sunday. Until then, good night, ciao..

I think Tamim should have got this. No, I won't share the award with Tamim, hopefully he gets it next time, quips, Mushfiqur Rahim, Man of the Match. I dedicate the award to my wife. The preparation was good.

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh captain: Tamim and Mushfiq batted really well, it was a good pitch to bat on. It was easy for us as a bowling unit. We just wanted to contain. It was a professional performance. This gives us the belief to win the series Thanks to the crowd for the support. I would want them to support us even when we don't perform well.

Azhar Ali, Pakistan captain: We made some mistakes in the field and dropped some catches at the wrong time and the credit goes to the Bangladesh batsmen. They got 30-40 runs extra. Rizwan batted well, we had a few positives. We will fix the mistakes and come strong in the next game.
Rafi: "after 16 years Bangladesh won against Pakistan. This was even bigger win than the first one. Congratulations Tigers!"

Ahead of the game, stand-in captain Shakib said that Bangladesh were favourites and his side rallied around to down Pakistan for the second time in ODIs, the first coming in the 1999 World Cup. After centuries from Tamim and Mushfiq led Bangladesh to 329, Azhar and Sohail laid a good base for the chase with a busy 89-run partnership. Rizwan was also impressive on debut, but the lower order imploded under scoreboard pressure, as Pakistan slumped from 217 for 4 to 250 all out.
Azweer: "Bangladesh Confidence running high after WC victory over England."
Taskin: All the boys are contributing. We are developing our skills day by day. We are in good shape. We are playing our best cricket

commentTextItems.html: pushed through on off, he manages an inside edge to the leg side

dismissalText.commentary: Junaid Khan run out (Sabbir Rahman) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: another yorker, which is dug out to point. The fielder nails a direct hit at the non-strikers' as there is a communication breakdown, but Junaid is in. Oh no, the bat is in the air. Nice, flat throw, hits the bullseye. The bat was in the air and Junaid has to depart for a duck. Poor mix-up..

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: 142.7kph yorker, right in the blockhole on off, dug out to the covers

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan c Nasir Hossain b Rubel Hossain 67 (58b 8x4 0x6 84m) SR: 115.51

commentTextItems.html: Another one bites the dust, Rizwan gone for 67 off 58. He fetches the slog sweep from outside off but top-edges it in the air. Nasir runs across to his right from deep square leg and swallows it

commentPostTextItems.html: M Usman: "This is gonna be Bangladesh's second win over Pakistan after that famous one in 99. Let them have it after 16 years."

commentTextItems.html: he shuffles across but does not connect with the lap-scoop
high full toss, over the waistline, that's a no-ball. The batsman looked to go over the leg side but ducks under it. Rubel put his hand up in apology straightaway
full toss outside off, that's a tripe ball. Rizwan backs away and pummels it between mid-off and the covers

dismissalText.commentary: Wahab Riaz b Taskin Ahmed 8 (12b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 66.66

commentTextItems.html: Taskin hoodwinks Wahab with a well-disguised slower one from the back of the hand. Wahab steps away and aims to slog it away over the leg side, but does not connect. He was way too early into it and Taskin hits the top of middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: slower ball from Taskin, Wahab waits on it, picks it up and lofts it in the air over midwicket
fired full and outside off, he loads up for a  slog-swipe. Gets an inside edge that runs away fine on the leg side
takes it from outside off, sinks to one knee and laps it to short fine
low full toss on middle, he flexes his muscles and powers it to the deep midwicket boundary
slippery bouncer from Taskin, gets big on Wahab, who is beaten on the pull

commentPreTextItems.html: MM: "Perfect, someone has worked up Wahab. Let er rip big fella. Expecting to see some 6s fly now"

commentTextItems.html: low full toss on middle and off, slapped to mid-off
low full toss outside off, squeezed to the right of the covers. The fielder does not collect the ball cleanly, only a single, though

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: yorker from Rubel, tails back in middle and strikes Wahab flush on the front boot as he was beaten for pace and was late to bring his bat down. The forefinger goes up, Wahab reviews, almost instantly. Might have been drifting down leg. Rubel fires a few verbal volleys at Wahab, who returns the favour. The umpire intervenes to hose down the verbal skirmishes. The Bangladesh players are confident.  Hawk-Eye shows that it was going down. The decision has been reversed.
flash and miss to a length ball outside off

commentPostTextItems.html: Isam pings me that Rizwan is the ninth Pakistan batsman to make a fifty on ODI debut.

commentTextItems.html: shortish and hurries on middle, he backs away and punches it to third man, Rizwan wanted a second, was halfway down the track and is sent back by Wahab

dismissalComment.html: Rahat Ali strikes! Mahmudullah steps away outside leg, seeks to crash it through the covers, but misses his stroke completely. This back-of-a-length slower ball crashes into the middle stump. It is knocked out

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Rizwan b Wahab Riaz
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Mohammad Rizwan b Wahab Riaz 132 (135b 15x4 3x6 186m) SR: 97.77

dismissalComment.html: And the stand has finally ended! This was dug in short, off-speed ball outside off as Tamim backs away. He initially looked to pull it away, then skews it high into the air. The man from covers (Azhar Ali I guess) and mid-off (Saad Nasim) converge, collide, but Saad Nasim just about hangs onto the catch. Tamim elicits a standing ovation

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c †Sarfaraz Ahmed b Wahab Riaz 106 (77b 13x4 2x6 117m) SR: 137.66

dismissalComment.html: End of a rapid knock from Mushfiq. Dug in on a back of a length and outside off, Mushfiq has a big swing at that, does not get hold of it. Nicks it to the keeper off a thick outside edge. He raises his bat and acknowledges the raucous cheers as he walks back to the hut. The umpires check for a possible no-ball, Wahab exults, that's a legal ball

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman b Wahab Riaz 15 (7b 1x4 1x6 12m) SR: 214.28

dismissalComment.html: Wahab has shattered the stumps. Why was he appealing? The leg stump is knocked out, that's your wicket Riaz. This was a near yorker hurled in from wide of the crease, Sabbir attempts a dinky little reverse-sweep and misses, the leg stump is rattled

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Wahab Riaz 31 (27b 4x4 0x6 41m) SR: 114.81

dismissalComment.html: Shakib given out lbw off the last ball. He wants to review, but this was crashing into the base of middle. Low full toss, Shakib shuffles across and misses the attempted sweep and rapped in front middle. The on-field umpire's decision prevails. But Bangladesh have put up a record-breaking total - their highest in ODIs

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Azhar Ali c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 72 (73b 7x4 0x6 118m) SR: 98.63

dismissalComment.html: Taskin sets off on a aeroplane celebration, a la Shoaib Akhtar, he is charged up. Azhar Ali perishes for 72. This was on a back of a length and outside off, Azar seeks to run it away through slip, instead edges it to the keeper, who moves to his right and snaffles it

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Arafat Sunny
dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed c Nasir Hossain b Arafat Sunny 24 (31b 3x4 0x6 42m) SR: 77.41

dismissalComment.html: Sarfraz goes for a  slog-sweep and holes out. This was flat on off, he does not middle the sweep, Nasir Hossain runs to his left from deep backward square leg and snaps up a sharp tumbling catch. Shakib is pumped. Sarfraz slams his bat onto the turf as he trudges back.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez run out (Soumya Sarkar/†Mushfiqur Rahim) 4 (7b 1x4 0x6 8m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Fine throw from Sarkar, Hafeez has been run out. Azhar uses his feet and drives it in front of mid-on off an inside edge. The pair look for a scampered single, Hafeez is late to take off. Sarkar swoops down on the ball and lasers an accurate, flat throw to the keeper, who whips the bails off to catch Hafeez short. He was guilty of ball watching and pays the penalty

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Sohail c Mahmudullah b Taskin Ahmed 51 (64b 4x4 1x6 88m) SR: 79.68

dismissalComment.html: Crucial strike, Harris has to depart, Taskin has his second. This was dug in short and rushes onto Haris, who miscues the pull in the air. Mahmudullah runs in from mid-on and pouches it, tumbling to the ground. Haris threw his head back as soon as he met the ball. He knew that he had made a hash of the pull

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan c Nasir Hossain b Rubel Hossain 67 (58b 8x4 0x6 84m) SR: 115.51

dismissalComment.html: Another one bites the dust, Rizwan gone for 67 off 58. He fetches the slog sweep from outside off but top-edges it in the air. Nasir runs across to his right from deep square leg and swallows it

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Arafat Sunny
dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam c Soumya Sarkar b Arafat Sunny 14 (19b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 73.68

dismissalComment.html: Fawad Alam steps away outside leg, Sunny follows him with a full toss, which is softly chipped to Sarkar, who reverse-cups his hands around it at mid-off. The bowler breaks into a little jig. The asking rate reads 10.59

dismissalText.commentary: Saad Nasim b Arafat Sunny 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Sunny knocks Nasim for a duck on debut. Nasim makes room, this was the arm-ball on off. Too close to cut, Nasim does not meet with the stroke. Cannons onto off

dismissalText.commentary: Wahab Riaz b Taskin Ahmed 8 (12b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Taskin hoodwinks Wahab with a well-disguised slower one from the back of the hand. Wahab steps away and aims to slog it away over the leg side, but does not connect. He was way too early into it and Taskin hits the top of middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Saeed Ajmal lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh break 16-year hoodoo with a 79-run win. Ajmal has been given out lbw, Shakib shakes hands with the umpire. Ajmal reviews. This was pushed through flat and quick from round the stumps, catches Ajmal on the front pad on the knee roll, looks like this was sliding down. Or was it clipping leg? No inner edge. Hawk-Eye shows that it would clip the top of leg. Bangladesh break the 16-year drought and record their second ODI win over Pakistan

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Junaid Khan run out (Sabbir Rahman) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: another yorker, which is dug out to point. The fielder nails a direct hit at the non-strikers' as there is a communication breakdown, but Junaid is in. Oh no, the bat is in the air. Nice, flat throw, hits the bullseye. The bat was in the air and Junaid has to depart for a duck. Poor mix-up..

dismissalText.commentary: Rahat Ali not out 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 44 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 13.5 overs (83 balls), Extras 2
Drinks: Bangladesh - 53/1 in 15.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 29, Mahmudullah 2)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 75 balls (6 x 4)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 24.2 overs (146 balls), Extras 2
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 43 balls (Tamim Iqbal 19, Mushfiqur Rahim 31, Ex 1)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 31.2 overs (188 balls), Extras 3
Drinks: Bangladesh - 162/2 in 33.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 89, Mushfiqur Rahim 45)
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 81 balls (Tamim Iqbal 53, Mushfiqur Rahim 46, Ex 1)
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 42 balls (6 x 4)
Tamim Iqbal: 100 off 112 balls (12 x 4, 2 x 6)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 55 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 36.4 overs (220 balls), Extras 4
3rd Wicket: 150 runs in 106 balls (Tamim Iqbal 85, Mushfiqur Rahim 62, Ex 3)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 42.1 overs (254 balls), Extras 9
Mushfiqur Rahim: 100 off 69 balls (13 x 4, 2 x 6)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 33 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 27, Shakib Al Hasan 23, Ex 0)
Bangladesh: 300 runs in 47.5 overs (288 balls), Extras 9
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 329/6 in 50.0 overs (Nasir Hossain 3)
Over 49.6: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - Shakib Al Hasan (Struck down)
Pakistan innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 52 runs, 0 wicket)
Pakistan: 50 runs in 9.4 overs (58 balls), Extras 4
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (Azhar Ali 23, Sarfraz Ahmed 23, Ex 4)
Drinks: Pakistan - 95/2 in 18.0 overs (Azhar Ali 46, Haris Sohail 17)
Pakistan: 100 runs in 19.1 overs (115 balls), Extras 4
Azhar Ali: 50 off 54 balls (5 x 4)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 53 balls (Azhar Ali 26, Haris Sohail 24, Ex 0)
Over 22.6: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - Haris Sohail (Struck down)
Pakistan: 150 runs in 28.1 overs (169 balls), Extras 5
Haris Sohail: 50 off 59 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
Drinks: Pakistan - 175/4 in 31.5 overs (Mohammad Rizwan 19)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 35 runs, 2 wickets)
Pakistan: 200 runs in 37.1 overs (223 balls), Extras 5
Mohammad Rizwan: 50 off 46 balls (6 x 4)
Over 42.5: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - RSA Palliyaguruge, Batsman - Wahab Riaz (Upheld)
Pakistan: 250 runs in 45.1 overs (272 balls), Extras 9
Over 45.2: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - Sharfuddoula, Batsman - Saeed Ajmal (Struck down)

milestones.description: Mushfiqur and Tamim Iqbal's 178-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 3rd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 174 between Mushfiqur and Anamul Haque
Tamim Iqbal has become the top scorer for BAN in ODIs with 4257 runs, going past Shakib's 4173
Mushfiqur and Tamim Iqbal's 178-run partnership is BAN's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 175 between Rajin Saleh and Habibul Bashar
Shakib has scored 34 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Mirpur

stories.title: Practice makes perfect for Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Mushfiqur Rahim put a four-month gap between ODIs behind him to propel Bangladesh to a comfortable victory over Zimbabwe

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives through the off side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives through the off side, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Mirpur, November 7, 2015

stories.title: 'One of Tamim's best innings' - Shakib
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'One of Tamim's best innings' - Shakib Al Hasan
stories.summary: There was an understanding that given his run of low scores, Tamim shouldn't have played the warm-up match in Fatullah and he made just nine. Yet Tamim struck back on Friday with his fifth ODI hundred.

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal brings out the reverse sweep
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal brings out the reverse sweep, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

stories.title: Hosts expose Pakistan's inexperience
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Pakistan captain Azhar Ali has singled out his side's lack of experience on the international stage as the biggest reason behind their 79-run defeat in Mirpur

image.caption: Azhar Ali and Haris Sohail run between the wickets
image.longCaption: Azhar Ali and Haris Sohail run between the wickets, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal punches the air in delight after reaching his ton
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal punches the air in delight after reaching his ton, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

stories.title: Tamim, Mushfiqur end 16-year wait
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: A partnership of 178 between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim set up a total of 329, Bangladesh's highest in ODIs, and a 79-run win that backed up their claims of entering the series as favourites

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim was overjoyed upon reaching hundred
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim was overjoyed upon reaching hundred, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

stories.title: Shakib urges Bangladesh to forget past record
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Shakib urges Bangladesh to forget past record
stories.summary: Bangladesh allrounder Shakib Al Hasan has urged his side to forget their past record against Pakistan and go into the first ODI of the three-match series with a winning mentality

image.caption: Bangladesh players get together after their six-wicket win
image.longCaption: Bangladesh players get together after their six-wicket win, Bangladesh v Scotland, World Cup 2015, Group A, Nelson, March 5, 2015

stories.title: 'We won't put Ajmal under pressure' - Waqar
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'We won't put Ajmal under pressure' - Waqar
stories.summary: Pakistan coach Waqar Younis has said there will not be pressure on Saeed Ajmal  to make an immediate impact

image.caption: Waqar Younis talks to the press at Pakistan's training camp
image.longCaption: Waqar Younis talks to the press at Pakistan's training camp, Lahore, July 21, 2014

stories.title: Pakistan begin life after Misbah and Afridi
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Pakistan begin life after Misbah and Afridi
stories.summary: The dysfunctional relationship between the BCB and PCB will be put aside as Bangladesh and Pakistan play their first bilateral series since December 2011

stories.title: Practice makes perfect for Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Mushfiqur Rahim put a four-month gap between ODIs behind him to propel Bangladesh to a comfortable victory over Zimbabwe

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives through the off side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives through the off side, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Mirpur, November 7, 2015

stories.title: 'One of Tamim's best innings' - Shakib
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'One of Tamim's best innings' - Shakib Al Hasan
stories.summary: There was an understanding that given his run of low scores, Tamim shouldn't have played the warm-up match in Fatullah and he made just nine. Yet Tamim struck back on Friday with his fifth ODI hundred.

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal brings out the reverse sweep
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal brings out the reverse sweep, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

stories.title: Hosts expose Pakistan's inexperience
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Pakistan captain Azhar Ali has singled out his side's lack of experience on the international stage as the biggest reason behind their 79-run defeat in Mirpur

image.caption: Azhar Ali and Haris Sohail run between the wickets
image.longCaption: Azhar Ali and Haris Sohail run between the wickets, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim was overjoyed upon reaching hundred
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim was overjoyed upon reaching hundred, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

recentReportStory.title: Tamim, Mushfiqur end 16-year wait
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
recentReportStory.summary: A partnership of 178 between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim set up a total of 329, Bangladesh's highest in ODIs, and a 79-run win that backed up their claims of entering the series as favourites

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim was overjoyed upon reaching hundred
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim was overjoyed upon reaching hundred, Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, April 17, 2015

recentReportStory.credit: Karthik Krishnaswamy is a senior sub-editor at ESPNcricinfo

recentPreviewStory.title: Pakistan begin life after Misbah and Afridi
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Pakistan begin life after Misbah and Afridi
recentPreviewStory.summary: The dysfunctional relationship between the BCB and PCB will be put aside as Bangladesh and Pakistan play their first bilateral series since December 2011

image.caption: Azhar Ali directs the ball to the off side
image.longCaption: Azhar Ali directs the ball to the off side, Pakistan v Australia, 2nd Test, Abu Dhabi, 1st day, October 30, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84
